relation: This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SRA.
This command is supported in the Cisco IOS Release 12.2SX train. Support in a specific 12.2SX release of this train depends on your feature set, platform, and platform hardware.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS Security Command Reference: Commands A to C - all profile map configuration through browser-proxy [Support] - Cisco

textBeforeTable: Syntax Description all no [no-auth] all To specify that all authentication and authorization requests be cached, use the allcommand in profile map configuration mode. To disable the caching of all requests, use the no form of this command. all (profile map configuration) browser-proxy browser-attribute import block count bind authenticate binary file bidirectional base-dn banner (WebVPN) banner (parameter-map webauth) banner backup group backup-gateway backoff exponential auto secure automate-tester (config-radius-server) automate-tester (config-ldap-server) auto-update client auto-rollover auto-enroll auth-type (ISG) auth-type authorize accept identity authorization username (tti-registrar) authorization username authorization list (tti-registrar) authorization list (global) authorization identity authorization address ipv4 authorization (tti-registrar) authorization (server-group) authorization authentication url authentication violation authentication trustpoint authentication timer restart authentication timer reauthenticate authentication timer inactivity authentication terminal authentication priority authentication port-control
textAfterTable: Command History Release Modification 12.2(28)SB This command was introduced. 12.2(33)SRC This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(33)SRC. 15.0(1)M This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 15.0(1)M. Usage Guidelines Use the all command to cache all authentication and authorization requests. Use the all command for specific service authorization requests, but it should be avoided when dealing with authentication requests. Examples The following example caches all authorization requests in the localusers cache profile group. No authentication is performed for these users because the no-auth keyword is used.  Router# configure terminal Router(config)# aaa new-model Router(config)# aaa cache profile localusers Router(config-profile-map)# all no-auth Related Commands
